result.execSummary:
The defendant Beth C Bachausen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $400.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance of  $43.00 to be paid along with payment plan on 15CT96.

FORTHWITH. First 90 days STRAIGHT TIME.
3 days credit.
Last 60 days STAYED and the defendant to be released from Huber to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days.
Concurrent with: to 15CT96

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beth C Bachausen

defendant.name: Bachausen, Beth C
defendant.address: 2016 Cliff Alex Ct South Unit B, Waukesha, WI 53189

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From WCS dated 10/23/15 re defendant's successful completion of DRC program.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Beth C Bachausen in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- 150 days jail Forthwith.  First 90 days jail Straight Time - 3 days credit. Last 60 Days jail STAYED and the defendant to be released from Huber to Day Report Center for compliance for 60 days.  Concurrent to sentence in 15CT96. 
- Court costs of $243.00 - apply bail; alternate 1 day jail - payment plan consecutive to 15CT96
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to fine
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Beth C Bachausen in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel P Fay.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
